results.title: Sirius puppy training with Dr. Ian Dunbar
results.creator_credit: Beth M Toth, Martin Bluford and Bluford-Toth Productions
results.brief_description: This video is the first comprehensive obedience, behaviour and temperament training program designed especially for puppies. Emphasising family participation, this video shows owners how to teach their puppy basic obedience commands such as “come”, “sit”, “heel”, and “stay”. Through daily handling and calming exercises, your puppy can also be taught to overcome biting, barking, and housetraining behavioural problems. The aim of the video is to train dogs to be good companions and a joy to live with.

results.title: Sisters in arms
results.brief_description: 100 years of Australian military nursing is celebrated in this collection of personal accounts and archival footage. The contribution of Australian nurses has spanned across many wars; the Boer War, Great War, World War 2, as well as battles in the Mediterranean, New Guinea and Vung Tau. It is from these often tragic environments that stories of hope, courage, duty, adventure and romance emerge and are shared with the viewer. Narrated by Geraldine Dooge.

results.title: Sister Wendy's odyssey. -Volume 2
results.creator_credit: John Hooper, Nicholas Rossiter and BBC
results.brief_description: Sister Wendy Beckett has a passion for art and leaves the confines of her religious silence in search of the art treasures she has found in books and on postcards. For Sister Wendy art represents a window to something greater, and when one is looking at art, one is looking at God. In this second part of the odyssey in which Sister Wendy openly shares her first impressions of seeing the art she’s admired, she visits Wilton House, Birmingham, and Edinburgh stopping to reflect on her favourite pieces. PLEASE NOTE: THERE IS A CLOCK TIMER BETWEEN EACH EPISODE ON THE TAPE.

results.title: Singapore: new Asia on stage (PC & MAC)
results.creator_credit: National Arts Council, Singapore Tourism Board and MM-Multimedia People
results.brief_description: System requirements: Pentium 166 CPU, Win95 0/S, 4xCD-ROM, 32 MB RAM, 16 bit sound card, 640x480 pixel resolution, 16 bit colour. Singapore is not only the cultural meeting point between the East and West, but also one of the most diverse and dynamic cities in the world. This CD Rom is an atmospheric, colourful, and informative guide to the role and works of various performing arts companies within Singapore. Explore a variety of artistic genres, including folk, classical, contemporary and avant garde in this compilation of stunning Singaporean talent.

results.title: Singlehanders
results.creator_credit: Kent Nason, Shelagh Mackenzie and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Alone on the open sea! Two Canadians, Bob Lush and Mike Birch, took cameras aboard their yachts during the 1980 Observer Singlehanded Transatlantic Race. The result is more than a record of this prestigious international sailing event. The sport of ocean racing becomes the starting point for an epic of challenge and determination.

results.title: Silks and Saddles (1921)
results.brief_description: This film is firmly within the genre of racecourse melodrama. On the prosperous stud farm of Kangarooie, the squatter’s daughter, Bobbie, is torn between rival suitors whilst her weak-willed brother is embroiled with racketeers and a high society vamp. After much complex criminal activity in the stables before the big race the heroine herself rides her horse to victory.

results.title: Sinatra: a passionate life
results.brief_description: Sinatra: A passionate life is a loving tribute to the late Frank Sinatra. It provides an excellent biographical overview of the singer, actor and all-round performer, ranging from his childhood years to retirement. We are introduced to Sinatra’s family, his place of birth, his admiration for Bing Crosby, his initial rise to fame, his huge success during World War II, his work in the film and TV industries, his Vegas years and experience with the Brat Pack, and so on. Interviews with numerous colleagues and close friends are interweaved with archival footage, photos and film excerpts. The archival footage is especially splendid including such rare and classic moments as Sinatra and Elvis Presley on live television performing each other’s songs or Dean Martin and Sammy Davis Jnr carrying out their legendary Brat Pack routines at the Sands casino in Las Vegas. Though completed just prior to Sinatra’s passing, “Sinatra: A passionate life” is overall both a fitting testament to the man’s unique talent, career achievements and influence and a record of the eras in which he performed.

results.title: Sin the movie (D)
results.creator_credit: Yasunori Urata, Andrew Orjuela and ADV Films
results.brief_description: Based on a popular video game, Sin the Movie is a compelling, action-packed tale set in Earth’s dystopic future. The city of Freeport has been rocked by a number of unexplained abductions involving a mutant humanoid. Colonel John Blade, leader of the elite strike force, Hardcorps, makes it his business to solve the mystery after one of his team is murdered by the monster. His efforts lead him to Sintek Industries, a multibillion dollar corporation headed by Elexis Sinclaire, brilliant biochemist and vicious vixen. When an adopted child, Elyse, is kidnapped, John and JC, the sister of his dead team-member, join forces to destroy the mutant, and stop Elexis from unleashing a genetically-engineered apocalypse upon the city. The director of this animation, Yasunori Urata, has been linked with a number of other important anime works, and is renowned for his stories, which combine human drama with spectacular action.

results.title: Simultaneous equations
results.brief_description: Examines simultaneous equations and inequations, and provides a basis for studying linear programming. Film No 2506. From the series “Vision in Mathematics”.

results.title: Silences of the palace = Les Silences du palais
results.creator_credit: Moufida Tlatli, Cinetelfilms, Magfilm and Mat Films
results.brief_description: This atmospheric first feature film from Tunisian director Mufida Tlatli is the story of Alia, the daughter of a beautiful servant in the palace of the last kings of Tunisia. Memories of her childhood, some pleasant, some painful, are brought to the surface when she returns to the crumbling palace that was both her home and her prison after the death of its patriarch - Sid’Ali. A sensitive, lucid portrayal of growing up in a world where women were not only in the palace to serve but were also to submit to the prince’s “rights of the bedchamber”, with luminous performances from Hend Sabri, as the young Alia, and Amel Hedhili as her overly vigilant mother, Khedija. In Arabic with English subtitles.
